title: Disabled kids in Vic bus-tractor crash
text:
More than 20 people, including children with intellectual disabilities, were on board a minibus that collided with a tractor in Victoria's northwest.

The students and staff from the Ballarat Specialist School were on the minibus when the crash occurred on the Sunraysia Highway at Lexton about 2pm on Friday, the Education Department confirmed.

The school caters to children with "a mild, moderate or complex intellectual disability" and are aged between 3 and 18, its website reads.

One person, believed to be a teacher, was flown by helicopter to the Royal Melbourne Hospital in a serious condition.

Twelve passengers were taken to Ballarat Base Hospital for observation, while 10 did not require treatment.

The tractor driver was not injured, the Ballarat Courier reports.

The highway is closed and investigations into the crash continue.
